alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 22 at 10:46AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN SAN DIEGO COUNTY... At 1046 AM PST, Multiple reports of heavy rain and flooded roadways including in Coronado and National City. Portions of the 163, I-5, and 805 are flooded near Downtown San Diego. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen, locally up to 2 inches. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 0.75 inches, locally up to 1 inch per hour in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Dangerous and life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing areas of flash flooding. SOURCE...Public, law enforcement, and automated gauges . IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chula Vista, El Cajon, National City, La Mesa, Poway, Imperial Beach, Coronado, Del Mar, North Park and Mission Valley. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
